If you have any questions, ask away and perhaps the community will answer.

I have one question. Why?

CV and Skype already have these functions, other VOIP Programs are server-based so they're a 'Club' in and of themselves. 90+ percent of any pre-made games I play are done using either Skype, Curse Voice or TeamSpeak.

It's just one more soon-to-be dead-weight feature that Riot added instead of focusing resources on something the community actually requested. Not to mention it's just an insult to people who used to play Ranked 5s which Riot has completely removed.

It's simple man this allows you to have a "Club" (or clan guide whatnot) instead of a ranked team its all about fun and not everyone uses these programs that you listed but this iv been waiting for, for a long time

Yeah, it allows quick, easy chat access over the game itself without having to find a Teamspeak server or set up a skype. In this way it's great for large groups of people on League who you might want to play with and can instantly message but perhaps don't know in person. Example, there is someone starting a Teemo Main's club on these boards at the moment.

The way I see it, clubs are a little like permanent parties. When you log out, you are instantly auto-joined to the chat when you come back online; connecting you to your other friends where you send messages (which remain there for awhile) easily. Unlike parties however, they don't allow you pre-determine or set up people in match-making for a game. In this case you still have to set up a match the normal way.  {{summoner:4}}
